intro: Ruschia caudata, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range from red to orange in color. The plant features succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain water in arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Ruschia caudata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and drought tolerance.
